TextView.android:text: Hacking: Unauthorized access to a computer system or network, or modifying computer data without permission.

Point 1 refers to the cyber crime of hacking, which is defined under Section 66 of the Indian Information Technology (IT) Act, 2000. Hacking involves unauthorized access to a computer system or network or modifying computer data without permission. Under Indian law, hacking is a criminal offense punishable with imprisonment and/or a fine. The punishment for hacking depends on the severity of the offense and the harm caused by the hacker. For example, if a hacker causes damage to a computer system or network, they may be punished with imprisonment for up to three years, a fine of up to two lakh rupees, or both. If the offense is more serious, the punishment can be imprisonment of up to 10 years and a fine of up to five lakh rupees.

In addition to criminal liability, a hacker may also be liable for civil damages if they cause harm or loss to the victim. Victims of hacking may be able to seek compensation for losses suffered as a result of the hacking, such as loss of data, loss of business, or damage to reputation.
